Check the crawler config for the =91statisticsTracker=92 bean. There should=
 be a commented out list of reports which represent the default reports tha=
t are generated. You should be able to uncomment this and manually specify =
which reports you would like.

~Adam

On Oct 24, 2013, at 6:29 AM, james@ra=
ctive.ch wrote:

> 
> Hello again
> 
> 
> 
> The reports that get generated=
 after a crawl take so long to finish. This is why the job cannot be teared=
 down...
> 
> Esp. the generation of the source-reports.txt file takes hour=
s. Is there a way to choose which reports should be generated and which not=
?
> 
> 
> 
> Best regards,
> 
> James
> 
> 
> 
> ---In archive-crawler@yaho=
ogroups.com, <nlevitt@...> wrote:
> 
> Hello James,
> 
> Since the job is f=
inished though it should be safe to simply kill heritrix.
> 
> First you co=
uld take a look at what heritrix is up to by running
> jstack on your herit=
rix process.
> 
> Noah
> 
> 
> On Thu, Oct 10, 2013 at 1:14 AM, <james@...>=
 wrote:
> >
> >
> > I waited for a couple of hours after I clicked on "tear=
down" and refreshed
> > the UI regularly. All buttons besides the "teardown=
" button are disabled and
> > the job stays in the ABORTED state.
> >
> >
>=
 > Regards,
> >
> > James
> >
> >
> >
> > ---In archive-crawler@yahoogroups=
.com, <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
> > wrote:
> >
> > Does it look oka=
y after you reload the page a few times? There are a few
> > stage-transiti=
ons in H3 where the UI does not get updated automatically and
> > you have =
to refresh to see the current state.
> >
> > Best wishes,
> > Andy
> >
> >
=
> > On 10 Oct 2013, at 07:54, <james@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> > Dear herit=
rix users
> >
> > I face the issue that jobs cannot be teared down. When I =
click "terdown" on
> > an aborted job, a flash message "waiting for job to =
finish" will be shown,
> > but the job never gets teared down. There are no=
 suspicious log entries or
> > other messages. Any ideas why this is happen=
ing?
> >
> > I installed openjdk 7. May it be an issue not running the orac=
le JVM?
> >
> >
> > Best regards,
> > James
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> 
>
